question: International Centre for Alternative Dispute Resolution is located in which country?
explanation: The headquarters of ICADR are at New Delhi & it was inaugurated by the Prime Minister of India on October 6, 1995. The ICADR is an autonomous organization working under the aegis of the Ministry of Law & Justice, Govt. of India. Regional Centers are at Hyderabad and Bangalore. In May 2010, foundation stone of new building of International Centre for Alternative Dispute Resolution have been laid by Veerappa Moily, Minister of Law and Justice, Government of India.
